numbered_ace_sentences: 1. China has had a much steeper increase in electricity generation than the US.
2. China has had a much steeper increase in electricity generation than India.
3. The world has had a steady increase in electricity generation.
4. Since 2010, wind energy has become a bigger contributor to electricity generation in the world.
5. Since 2010, solar energy has become a bigger contributor to electricity generation in the world.
6. I wonder why China has had such a big increase in electricity generation compared to the US.
7. I wonder why China has had such a big increase in electricity generation compared to India.
8. I wonder what could lead the world to use more clean power than fossil fuels to generate electricity.
9. I wonder what the next 20 years will look like.
10. The graphs show that the US increases the use of wind energy to generate electricity.
11. The graphs show that the US increases the use of solar energy to generate electricity.
12. This increase suggests that the US tries to move toward clean power.
13. The US may stay at a steady rate of electricity generation.
14. If the US stays at a steady rate of electricity generation, clean power may replace more fossil fuels in electricity generation in the US.
15. If clean power replaces fossil fuels, electricity generation will be cleaner.
16. The headline is: How the world's generation of electricity has changed over the last 20 years.
